osyfe.graphic

Class Mesh

  • java.lang.Object
    • osyfe.graphic.Rendable<Mesh>
      • osyfe.graphic.Mesh
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Deletable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Text

    public class Mesh
extends Rendable<Mesh>
    Manages vertex data which share buffers and/or belong logically to each other (e.g. level of details of the same object).

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Mesh.DynamicBuffer
      Represents a dynamic vertex data buffer.

      • dataInstance

      • dataInstance

        public Mesh dataInstance(java.lang.String name,
                         float[] data,
                         int size,
                         int type)
        default: divisor = 1.

      • dataInstance

        public Mesh dataInstance(java.lang.String name,
                         float[] data,
                         int size,
                         int type,
                         int divisor)
        Declares float instance data for the current active geometry.
        Parameters:
        name - The attribute name as it appears in the shader code.
        data - The data.
        size - The amount of floats per instance.
        type -
        0 for lossless 4 byte floats.
        8, 16, 10_10_10_2 for (0 - 1) normalized data to give a 1, 2 or 10+10+10+2 byte truncation.
        -8, -16, -10_10_10_2 for (-1 - 1) normalized data to give a 1, 2 or 10+10+10+2 byte truncation.
        +/- 10_10_10_2 can be used with size = 3 or size = 4, in the former case 0s are written into the last slot.
        divisor - The amount of instances which share this instance data.

      • dataInstance

        public Mesh dataInstance(java.lang.String name,
                         int[] data,
                         int size)
        default: unsigned = false, divisor = 1.

      • dataInstance

        public Mesh dataInstance(java.lang.String name,
                         int[] data,
                         int size,
                         boolean unsigned)
        default: divisor = 1.

      • dataInstance

        public Mesh dataInstance(java.lang.String name,
                         int[] data,
                         int size,
                         boolean unsigned,
                         int divisor)
        Declares int instance data for the current active geometry.
        Parameters:
        name - The attribute name as it appears in the shader code.
        data - The data.
        size - The amount of ints per instance.
        unsigned - true for unsigned integer data. The data will be saved with 1 or 2 bytes if possible (instead of 4).
        divisor - The amount of instances which share this instance data.

      • dataInstance

        public Mesh dataInstance(java.lang.String name,
                         int[] data,
                         int size,
                         int divisor)
        default: unsigned = false.

      • dataVertex

        public Mesh dataVertex(java.lang.String name,
                       float[] data,
                       int size,
                       int type)
        Declares float vertex data for the current active geometry.
        Parameters:
        name - The attribute name as it appears in the shader code.
        data - The data.
        size - The amount of floats per vertex.
        type -
        0 for lossless 4 byte floats.
        8, 16, 10_10_10_2 for (0 - 1) normalized data to give a 1, 2 or 10+10+10+2 byte truncation.
        -8, -16, -10_10_10_2 for (-1 - 1) normalized data to give a 1, 2 or 10+10+10+2 byte truncation.
        +/- 10_10_10_2 can be used with size = 3 or size = 4, in the former case 0s are written into the last slot.

      • dataVertex

        default: unsigned = false.

      • dataVertex

        public Mesh dataVertex(java.lang.String name,
                       int[] data,
                       int size,
                       boolean unsigned)
        Declares int vertex data for the current active geometry.
        Parameters:
        name - The attribute name as it appears in the shader code.
        data - The data.
        size - The amount of ints per vertex.
        unsigned - true for unsigned integer data. The data will be saved with 1 or 2 bytes if possible (instead of 4).

      • dynamicDataInstance

        public Mesh.DynamicBuffer.F dynamicDataInstance(java.lang.String name,
                                                float[] data,
                                                int size,
                                                int type,
                                                int divisor)
        Creates and returns a dynamic float instance buffer for the current active geometry.
        Parameters:
        name - The attribute name as it appears in the shader code.
        data - The data.
        size - The amount of floats per instance.
        type -
        0 for lossless 4 byte floats.
        8, 16, 10_10_10_2 for (0 - 1) normalized data to give a 1, 2 or 10+10+10+2 byte truncation.
        -8, -16, -10_10_10_2 for (-1 - 1) normalized data to give a 1, 2 or 10+10+10+2 byte truncation.
        +/- 10_10_10_2 can be used with size = 3 or size = 4, in the former case 0s are written into the last slot.
        divisor - The amount of instances which share this instance data.

        default: divisor = 1.

      • dynamicDataInstance

        public Mesh.DynamicBuffer.I dynamicDataInstance(java.lang.String name,
                                                int[] data,
                                                int size,
                                                int type,
                                                int divisor)
        Creates and returns a dynamic int buffer for the current active geometry.
        Parameters:
        name - The attribute name as it appears in the shader code.
        data - The data.
        size - The amount of ints per vertex.
        type - +/- 8, 16, 32 for unsigned/signed 1, 2, 4 byte integers.
        divisor - The amount of instances which share this instance data.

      • dynamicDataInt

      • dynamicDataVertex

        public Mesh.DynamicBuffer.F dynamicDataVertex(java.lang.String name,
                                              float[] data,
                                              int size,
                                              int type)
        Creates and returns a dynamic float vertex buffer for the current active geometry.
        Parameters:
        name - The attribute name as it appears in the shader code.
        data - The data.
        size - The amount of floats per vertex.
        type -
        0 for lossless 4 byte floats.
        8, 16, 10_10_10_2 for (0 - 1) normalized data to give a 1, 2 or 10+10+10+2 byte truncation.
        -8, -16, -10_10_10_2 for (-1 - 1) normalized data to give a 1, 2 or 10+10+10+2 byte truncation.
        +/- 10_10_10_2 can be used with size = 3 or size = 4, in the former case 0s are written into the last slot.

        data - The data.
        size - The amount of ints per vertex.
        type - +/- 8, 16, 32 for unsigned/signed 1, 2, 4 byte integers.
